message_1: Let A = {1, 3, 5, 7} and B = {2, 3, 5, 8}. Find the intersection and union of A and B.
message_2:
The intersection of A and B, denoted as A ∩ B, is the set of elements that are common to both A and B. In this case, A ∩ B = {3, 5}.

The union of A and B, denoted as A ∪ B, is the set of elements that are in either A or B or in both. In this case, A ∪ B = {1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 8}.
